page.title: 14Chislehurst-local history.
page.content: Although we live near London,we are lucky to have lots of grassland surounding us with trees and woods. When walking through Chislehurst you come to Chislehurst Commons.Chislehurst Commons are owned by the National Trust.On the commons gravel has been dug away to form big dips.Rain has filled the dips and formed ponds.There are two ponds,Prickend Pond and Rush Pond.Some people call them top and bottom pond.Top pond is Rush Pond and the bottom pond is Prickend Pond. Chislehurst got its name from the Anglo-Saxons.They named it Ceosol Hyrst which means "a wood on gravel".
